Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: So, coasting time is officially over. Big changes are comin', and they're comin' fast. If you don't like 'em, this is called a door. You can walk right through it. Alright. I'm not here to be your friend. I like my life outside of this place. I live to leave at 5. Change number one:

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: They are trying to figure me out. And I don't like it. Once they figure me out, they start to tell me what I want to hear. And I need to quickly figure out who's a good worker and who is simply a good mind reader. Because as soon as I'm hearing what I want to hear, I'm not gonna care.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Change two, Toby, you're gettin' a new chair.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Don't thank me! Hey, don't thank me, guy! Okay? And I don't care if you like it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: These sound like good ideas, why wouldn't we like them?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I don't care what your favorite flavor is. Here's a bowl of ice cream. You either like it or you don't. [Andy nods] That's my attitude right now in this room, that's my attitude on Ice Cream Thursdays. Alright? Clear? Any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This all sounds great to me. [hesitates] But I could see how some people might think that they're bad. I don't know what to think.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: That is a s- astute observation, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Kev's got me pegged. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: It blows away Vermont in the fall.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Snap, for real?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning, Deangelo.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hold on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [continuing to talk to Darryl] And if you're really serious, you should go in the spring.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because of the flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No. Because the entire state smells like Earth.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dogwoods, or just the Earth.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, well, good morning. I think I have good news for you today. I found your new executive assistant. My friend Carla. [looking at resume] She's got great experience. We even considered making her Cece's godmother, but she had this boyfriend at the time- but here's her resume.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Put it with the rest.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [entering his office] Hey dudes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, he hates me!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No he doesn't. You just get so nervous and hyper around him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Every time there's a silence, your brain's like "Heh-heh-huh-huh" [imitating crying].

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is that what he tells you at your little inner circle meetings?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Careful. There is no inner circle.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, there's an inner circle. Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There is no inner circle. Deangelo just prefers to delegate a few things, to a few guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jim only says that because he's in the inner circle. I also say that because I am also in the inner circle. Did you get that, Ma? Your boy, Kevin Malone, is IN the inner circle! [thinks] Which doesn't exist.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [holding two cups of coffee] There he is! Got ya coffee. [offers cup to Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, thank you. That was so kind of you. [throws cup in the garbage]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Not a coffee guy, I take it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just that I own the coffee shop. So, once you've seen sausage being made, all you want to do is make sausage, because it's so much fun.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Listen. I've got a sixer. "Automatic for the People" on the jukebox. Let's hit the park after sundown. Come on! Pick up some sausage if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think you'll find what you're looking for [points toward Oscar] over there.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No matter how many times I reach out to Dwight, he doesn't seem to want anything to do with me. It reminds me of my relationship with my son. Except there, I'm the Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Who's the biggest client in the state? I say we go get 'em, whatever it takes. Huh? What do you guys say?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Right! Or my other idea, 50,000 tiny clients.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I say we just go for it!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [shoots mini basketball at hoop on office door, misses badly] Is that ball lighter than usual? Is that a Chinatown knockoff?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's Toys R Us, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No, that's definitely a knockoff. You can feel the center of gravity's off. Feel that. [throws ball to Gabe] What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [holding ball in open palm] Oh, yeah, totally. Jim, you got ripped off big time.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [calling for the ball] Deangelo! [shoots and makes it] See what I did there? That's what you need to do. [makes shooting gesture] It's that little English. The British are coming.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Deangelo's open!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hey Ry. Your department's killing it, baby. [puts arm around Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey hey, my pleasure, my treasure.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Keep it up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The problem with having "It" or "the X-factor" or whatever it is you want to call it, is that it's impossible to put into words what you're bringing to the table. So to make things simpler for Deangelo, I just, without lying, strongly implied that I'm Kelly's supervisor. It's not even that much of a stretch. She pretty much does whatever I say.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why should I pretend that you are my boss?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Because what would you have done in that situation, Kelly? I'll tell you what I would have done for you. I'd lie for you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but you lie all the time. You lie for no reason. Ryan, you just like to lie.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd die for you too.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You really would?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [hears Deangelo entering] Hey, Kelly Kapoor, if I don't have those call logs on my desk, we're just gonna have to evaluate your future at the company!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sure thing, Mr. Howard.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Woo. Glad he's not my boss.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispers to Kelly] You're the best. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: You know I have a cousin who cracked the secret formula for a certain popular cola that I shall not name. So I've never had to buy it. True story. I just drink my cousin's.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Congratulations on your one cousin. I have seventy. Each one better than the last.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: You know what... straight up, why don't you like me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm just not a suck-up like everyone else around here. Okay? I do my job well, so why don't you just leave me alone and let me do it. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ohhhh no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Okay? I'm gonna win you over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes I am.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes-yes-yes-yes-yes [starts to run out of the break room] yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looking at resume] Uh oh, this former administrative assistant misspelled "administrative" and "assistant."

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The winner:

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Sorry gang. Thought my juggling stuff was in the trunk of my car. It's not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no, do you think it was stolen?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I gotcha covered, boss. Used to play with the parabolas myself. [opens desk drawer and takes out balls] Got some extra balls! [throws them toward Deangelo, who dodges them] Hey-hey-hey-ho!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Sorry, I never touch another juggler's instruments. You know, we're all here, I've got the music cued, why don't I just do my routine without the juggling balls? [starts to play "Wake Me Up Inside" by Evanescence] Prepare... to go into the danger zone. [begins pretend juggling routine]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh wow, you weren't kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No. Never. Can someone please throw me a fifth ball? If you dare! [Kevin pretends to throw ball] Incoming! And we're on! Remember, nothing's impossible! Phyllis, where's Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Here.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Do you believe in me, Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Because I believe in you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [pretending to bounce balls off Phyllis at close range] Feel that connection? Don't move your head. Please. Thank you. Oh! Big hand for Phyllis! [clapping] That took a lot of guts! [finishes routine] Ho! I'm Deangelo Vickers, thank you so much, hope you learned something.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Didn't drop a single ball!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [imitating Deangelo's pretend juggling routine] Look. I'm juggling eggs and bowling balls. I'm juggling with one hand. No hands.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What could he possibly stand to gain from a fake juggling routine?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What could he possibly stand to gain from a real juggling routine? How can you keep defending him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's good at his job. And I like working for him.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Of course you do, Jim. You're a man. Deangelo is a huge sexist.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. I think if he was sexist, I'd be able to tell. I took a crapload of women's studies courses at Cornell. And I wrote my own companion piece to the "Vagina Monologues" called the "Penis Apologies." So I know a thing or two.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. Then how about I'm the head of the Accounting Department, but he only ever talks to Kevin? What about Pam and Kelly? Also department heads. But has he ever met with you or even asked you to do anything?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How could I not see it? You're so right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Why don't you talk to him about it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And say what? "Hey Deangelo, are you shy or just a sexist?"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why don't you just tell him how his actions are being perceived by the women in this office?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And if he doesn't listen, then he can kiss his penis goodbye. Snip snip. Am I right, girls?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you got a second?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yeah, I got tons of time. This job's a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: So what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm, really, it's nothing, I was just talking to Angela, and she was --

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [opening door to Deangelo's office] Hey, saw Jim come in. We meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yeah sure. Let's make it a meeting. [Darryl, Kevin, Gabe enter office]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If it's alright, can I just have like one minute alone, just to go over --

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: What's the big secret? Why are you even whispering? Come on, it's the guys!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. [Gabe and Darryl stand on either side of Jim with paper and pens in hand] Just the guys. Well, maybe that's, uh, part of the problem. I think...so what happened was, I was talking with some of the department heads. Uh, some of the female department heads.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Uh-oh. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hot!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe there's a vibe out there, with certain members of the office, that you are...a little sexist, or --

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Damn!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa. Whoa. Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Are you serious? Who feels this way?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Like nobody.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Umm, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was --

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Was it Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That sounds like Pam. You know how she gets. Deangelo, she can get really bitchy. [begins bad imitation of Pam] Kevin...

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Guys. Hold on. Doesn't matter who, okay? I'm just happy that Jim brought it to my attention because honestly, I had - I had no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [on phone] Mom, Ryan's taking us out to dinner tonight. No, no, he's not going to stand us up like he did last time. He won't ever stand us up again.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [joint talking head with Kelly] So I am the new customer service supervisor.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: When Deangelo's around.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And I am also a very dutiful boyfriend when --

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: All the time.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All the time.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Erin, do you mind running down to the lobby and bringing up my brand new executive assistant?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, who'd you end up hiring?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm glad you asked, Jim. Because apparently there's a rumor running around here that I am a sexist. I can't work here effectively if you guys think I'm something that I am not. I am not a sexist. Raise your hand if you have a vagina. [Deangelo raises hand, Kelly and Pam sheepishly raise hands] Raise your hand if someone you love has a vagina. [Deangelo raises other hand, along with rest of office] Yeah, yeah. Okay. Just about everyone. What about Deangelo's hand? Oh wow. He's got 'em both up. [Ryan raises both hands] Yeah. Uh huh. [others raise both hands] Yeah, so it bothers me when I hear that there's gossip around here that I treat women lesser than men. Okay? Frankly, we all look a little ridiculous when that happens.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm not a feminist, but I think that the men in this office are being given chances that the women aren't.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Dwight, what's your take?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's the argument here? NBA, WNBA. One is a sport, one is a joke. I love sports, I love jokes. Room for all.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Man, you're smart. [Erin arrives with new executive assistant] Oh, hey! Hi! Hello. Welcome. Uh, everyone, I'd like you to please welcome Jordan Garfield. This is everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, Jordan, uh, where did you work before? Uh, a law office?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: No, Anthropology. We don't have this in that size, pretty lame.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Lame? You worked at Anthropology?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's like my dream job. How did you even get that job?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Well, I umm -

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You chose this job over that job?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, back to work, Kelly, we have a lot to get done today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, umm, is this your first office job then?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No corporate experience whatsoever. I didn't want anyone with any bad habits.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [heading into Deangelo's office] Jim, you coming?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, did he text us?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Jim looks at cell phone as Dwight's phone vibrates]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [holds up phone and looks into Deangelo's office] No!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, what are you doing? Get in there. This is not the time to take a stand. At least he likes one of us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He didn't text me. [Andy's phone chimes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm going in, into the belly of the beast. Gonna infiltrate and change from within. [joins the group in Deangelo's office] What's up, mancave! [makes barking noises]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Just go in. Just go in, he probably forgot to text you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Internally, for office use [Jim quietly enters Deangelo's office and sits down] where do we get our paper from? Do we go -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Jordan] Don't worry, the first day's always the hardest.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [staring at Jim] Hey Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Just... [Deangelo continues staring at him] Okay. [gets up and leaves office]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, he kicked you out of the inner circle, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, there is no inner...circle.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Dwight? Deangelo wanted me to ask you if there's anything I can help you with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? Anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Do you need anything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Deangelo, tell your whore to leave me alone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, I do not want to waste your time, so I will keep this br-r-r-r-r-r-ief. Now, word on the street is, Mercy Hospital, back on the market. Deangelo would like you to put together a sales pitch for next week. Deangelo has also recently learned about the Barnacle Project. Which is a non-profit organization based in Mystic, Connecticut that assists in the scraping of barnacles --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So this is my life. Until I win the lottery [laughs]. Or Pam finally writes that series of young adult books.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So one afternoon, while walking home from school, quirky 10th grader Becky Walters finds a wounded Pegasus in the woods. And she becomes...The Horse Flyer.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey! Kelly, that's the last time I'm gonna talk to you about your paycheck! Okay? We pay you a fair salary here, and if you're only here for the money, maybe you shouldn't be here at all.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No one likes a money grubber.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Mr. Howard, I apologize for grubbing for money. I can't do this. I can't do this. I'm sorry. I just can't do it. Deangelo, Ryan is not my boss. Okay? Frankly, he hasn't had a real job here in years.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, that's hilarious, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, he's just a big fraud, Deangelo. He's like Rango. He doesn't work here, basically. Just like the way Rango didn't save those animals. It was just a big misunderstanding.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Is this true, Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I did not see Rango.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Okay, I don't have time for this he said-she said.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: He's not saying anything!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: It's too murky. I like Ryan. You seem kind of hysterical to me. Ryan's your supervisor. Let's just leave it that way.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's not fair, I mean, I've been working here for such a long ti- [Deangelo walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh, close call! Okay, why don't you just finish this up and leave it on my desk and I will see you at your place around 2 am.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [knocking on door to Deangelo's office as loud yelling comes from inside it] Hey! It sounds like you guys are having a lot of fun, but it's really loud, and some of us are trying to work, so do you think you could do it a little more quietly?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, that's gonna be tough, because we're getting a dunking clinic from Magic Jordan himself.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Oh, you mean Michael Jordan?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [laughs] Total brain burp.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I'm no MJ. I can do his dunk. From the free throw line.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Daaamn! Mad respect for my brotha!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The man is paying me to take Chinese. I will say what I need to say, and soon, I will say it in Chinese.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well it's just really loud.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Okay. We'll keep that in mind. Alright, ladies, back to the game.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Do it!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Jim! Come on in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're back in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Instead of a game, why don't we do an exhibition? I'd love to see that dunk of yours.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yeah, we'll set that up one day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today. Now, maybe. 'Cause we have a hoop downstairs and a real ball, so you don't have to mime it.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Only because no one has called NASA to request a liftoff. [laughter] Let's go downstairs! Okay? Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pass. If I wanted to see a pissing contest, I'd lock Mose in the chicken coop.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Damn it, Dwight! Enough! Get your ass downstairs or find a new place to sell paper! [Dwight immediately gets up and walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, a little about me. I respond to strong leadership.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Seems a little close, you sure that's the real foul line?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 15 feet from the baseline, so, you need me to move it in?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Nah, that's 15. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: And uh, you know what, to make it interesting, Jordan, why don't you sit underneath the basket?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yeah, come on. I'll dunk over you. Best seat in the house.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: I don't, I don't think I can do that. I'm holding your jewelry.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Right. Yeah. Okay, fair enough. Kevin, you do it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! Okay. [sits down in front of basket]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Someone want to sit in Kevin's lap? Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Okay, Jimmy, this is for you. Show you that anything is possible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: This is also for the troops. [backs up, bounces ball, starts running, jumps, lands in front of Kevin, jumps again, pulls himself up by the net, dunks ball, hangs on rim] Doctor is in! [hoop starts to fall] Ahhhh! [hoop crashes down on Deangelo]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [ambulance pulls away in parking lot] Now what?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Deangelo enters office in hospital gown with bandage on his head] Deangelo?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [speaking gibberish] Tablab.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, are you alright? Erin, will you call 911 please?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who should I say is calling?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [lots of gibberish] says to bartender [lots more gibberish] Droswip. Droswip.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Droswip, yeah. I get it. Okay, we're gonna get you to the restroom.
